In my Inbox or other folders I see threaded groups like:
AAAAA
  Re: AAAAA
    Re: AAAAA
    BBBBB
    Re: BBBBB

Where there is no relationship between subjects AAAAA and BBBBB.  In this example, the two different subjects should have resulted in two different thread groupings.  Since unrelated subjects are added to existing threads, it makes it difficult to detect new topics unless every thread is expanded.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Turn on threading in a given folder
2.Examine folder threads after some messages have accumulated
3.Observe unrelated subjects grouped in same thread
Actual Results:  
Unrelated subjects were grouped in the same thread

Expected Results:  
Each subject should have a unique thread.

I see the same thing very frequently, from message sources that are completely unrelated.  For example, in my Trash, I currently have a thread that includes SF.net email list traffic, SF.net tracker item email, AND a few emails from my wife.

I also have a TB thread that includes messages from 4 different threads from 3 SF mailing lists (from the same project).  The 'parent' message from each thread has no References or In-Reply-To header, and I have mail.strict_threading=true, so they should not be grouped together.  The only commonality between the messages is that the first 6 characters of the subject are the same: "[fink-", but the rest is completely different.  And even then, in the messed up thread in the first paragraph above, the subject lines from the various real threads have no commonality.

Another TB thread lumps together messages between a previous coworker and myself, and messages between several family members.  The subject lines have no commonality.
